nodes.bodyText: Do we need any special handling of candidateA == candidateB?

Since this is based on randomness, should we have a separate constructor overload for AdaptiveLoadBalancer taking in Random instance explicitly? This would allow us to use a deterministic seed for unit tests.
Consider adding @Override to createNodeMetrics, increaseWeights and received

Should use equals() instead of ==.
Also consider flipping argument order to implicitly handle type == null in case no balancer type is present.

commit.message:
Follow up after PR comments.
- Make system test deterministic.
- Add @Override and be consistent on white space.
Ensure we can not pick the same candidate twice. This make it react a lot faster especially with few nodes.
